I #8217;m new to this stuff too, but I believe you probably should cleanse every single ingredient you use when you first get them and when they feel #8216;dirty #8217;. So I #8217;d say yes. Also make sure you wash them with water before use, they can get moldy.
I do not understand what you just said

WRITING.TITLE: Are these pronouns offensive?
WRITING.TEXT: I was looking at Neopronouns (pronouns other than she, they, and he) and I found fae/faer/faers. I #8217;m wondering if that #8217;s offensive to the fae? It sounds like they might be. Edit: btw I #8217;m not interested in using them. I believe I #8217;m just going to stick to they/them for now. If I don #8217;t, I #8217;ll probably use xe/xem/xyrs.

WRITING.TITLE: Are genderfluid lesbians valid?
WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;m genderfluid, and most of the time a feel at least a little feminine. I #8217;m also attracted to everyone but men. I #8217;m thinking about using the term lesbian as it is nonbinary inclusive, but I want to know your thoughts. [View Poll](https://www.reddit.com/poll/i5jzcf)
I think it #8217;s because there #8217;s so much hate towards enby lesbians. I #8217;ve found most of the hate is from non-lesbians though, which is weird.

Yeah. Like someone would say they #8217;re nonbianry and a lesbian, and people would start attacking them. I #8217;ve seen it happen so much. Most of the time the attackers aren #8217;t trans or lesbian.

WRITING.TITLE: Are genderfluid lesbians valid?
WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;m genderfluid, and most of the time a feel at least a little feminine. I #8217;m also attracted to everyone but men. I #8217;m thinking about using the term lesbian as it is nonbinary inclusive, but I want to know your thoughts.
I would love some :)
Thanks!
Yeah, but every article I read ends in her just saying she #8217;s thinking about making a new term :/
It logs in but the game data just goes to her account too.
So basically, is there a way to delete the data off her Facebook account?

WRITING.TITLE: My cat darts around the room at night. How can I make her stop?
WRITING.TEXT: As the title says, my cat darts around the room at night and it #8217;s very loud, therefore it keeps me up. Sometimes she bats at my foot too, which can be painful. How do I make her stop? I #8217;ve tried playing with her before I go to bed to let that energy out, but she just ignores it. I #8217;ve told her to stop, but of course she #8217;s a cat so she doesn #8217;t care. Wo do keep her in my room (which I pretty big) due to two reasons; we can #8217;t install a cat door (at least yet) and I really need my personal space so I can #8217;t leave my door open, and she #8217;s very prone to hiding and getting lost somewhere for five days. Got trapped in our wall once. During the day she #8217;s very calm and affectionate. I don #8217;t understand how she #8217;s so different at night.

She only stops when I pet her, but then I stop and she starts again. I #8217;ve had to move where I was sleeping for 4 days in a row due to this. I have no idea what to do and honestly I #8217;m getting very sick of it. Help?

WRITING.TITLE: Would my therapist tell me my mental illnesses if I #8217;m a minor?
WRITING.TEXT: Just wondering. I feel as if I have depression and anxiety but she hasn #8217;t told me anything. By the way, I #8217;m there because I #8217;m a self harmer, but when I first started I #8217;d only cut once. (My friend noticed and asked so I told her) though that number has increased.

WRITING.TITLE: I #8217;m planning on tell my therapist I #8217;m considering suicide and I know how I #8217;d do it. She #8217;ll probably send me to a psych ward and honestly I hope she does. Any tips?
WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;m a minor by the way #10084; #65039;
The thought of telling her is stress inducing enough, I cannot tell my parents face to face. Also I can #8217;t drive, so me taking myself is out of the picture.
I do know how. I #8217;ve even done research. I #8217;m scared of myself honestly. I #8217;m also too scared to ask for help and I don #8217;t know what to do

They #8217;re amazing and so supportive of me, I don #8217;t know why I #8217;m so anxious about it. I guess I just don #8217;t want them to worry. The first time I self harmed I told a friend and she told the counselor at school. My parents didn #8217;t mention it much because (I assume) they could tell I was uncomfortable but they seemed worried.
Yeah sorry, should #8217;ve clarified that.

Thank you. I can #8217;t seem to make up my mind. I decide I #8217;m going to tell her (my therapist) then two seconds later I can #8217;t. I can just imagine my mom crying; she #8217;s very emotional. She #8217;ll be scared for me. She #8217;ll worry about me. How can I be okay when I put her through that by asking for help? Right now she #8217;s happy.

Also there are tons of other things that can cause trauma, it #8217;s not just having bad parents. Edit: for example, I #8217;m transgender and not straight. That in itself causes a lot, but add the fact a live in Texas and I #8217;m doomed.
You are acting very aggressive. You found out I don #8217;t have abusive parents and that I have nice friends and you told me to evaluate myself. Also bold of you to assume those friends stayed.
No, the wouldn #8217;t, but they used to be and we were referring to them as my friends so it wouldn #8217;t of made sense to suddenly call them something else.
Seriously, no need to be aggressive. I #8217;m autistic, some things I don #8217;t understand as well as you neutotypicals.

Sorry, you #8217;re just causing me a lot of distress and made me relapse. You keep making it seem like my trauma isn #8217;t valid because my parents aren #8217;t abusive. You were nit-picking every single thing I said. You really think that #8217;s going to make me better or something? It #8217;s just making me worse.

I read that. But the way you worded it made me think that #8217;s what you were saying, and I know that #8217;s not what you meant, but that #8217;s what it felt like to me. You really should think about that next time you talk to someone.
Yeah a label is important to me, I don #8217;t know why. I guess to find people who understand me? I #8217;m not sure.
It #8217;s kind of hard to get help without a diagnosis-

WRITING.TITLE: I made this #128158; also yes I have eyebrows, I just have albinism.
May someone help me?
WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;m so close to doing it tonight. I #8217;ve had a plan for a while, just never a date. Part of me wants to part of me knows I shouldn #8217;t. So please, some sort of encouragement not too? Jokes, reasons to stay, anything. I want to feel better.

A lot, my friend. I #8217;ll try to simplify it. This isn #8217;t near everything, just a few things that come to mind: -my #8216;friend #8217; used to verbally harass me for being LGBTQ, I only got away when I transferred to online school -All of my #8216;friends #8217; have either abandoned me or absolutely hate me with a passion -The teachers at the online school I #8217;ve been going to (I transferred before 2nd semester of last year) don #8217;t care about my real pronouns and name, one of them even said it was a #8216;nickname #8217; -Every time I talk about something I like my oldest sister and one of my cousins nit-picks me and other people get annoyed but don #8217;t say anything (I #8217;m autistic, so I talk about things I like a lot) -I #8217;ve lost the ability to hide my stims in public, so people are always glaring at me -I #8217;m transgender, the entire country I live in hates me and I hate my body so much -No one takes me seriously since I #8217;m literally 13, therefore I don #8217;t matter in the eyes of society and when I open up people always say #8220;you #8217;re so young, there #8217;s so much more life ahead of you, these years don #8217;t matter #8221; -People always invalidate my trauma because I don #8217;t have abusive parents -I #8217;ve gotten addicted to self harm and I don #8217;t see a way out -I hate confrontation, so even though I have a therapist I can #8217;t ask for help and I #8217;ve been lying for months -I feel like a fake because I don #8217;t have any diagnosis of being mentally ill but I #8217;m definitely not stable. My therapist is technically a counselor, so she may not be able to diagnose me but again, I can #8217;t ask -No one seems to care enough to check if I #8217;m actually okay. I #8217;m very surprised how long I #8217;ve been able to keep this act up and how easy it is (8 months, it #8217;s been 8 months) So yeah there #8217;s a few

No I haven #8217;t. I don #8217;t want anyone to worry because I know everyone will, whether it #8217;s fake or not I #8217;m not sure, but they #8217;ll at least act like it #8217;s affecting them and I can #8217;t do that.
She #8217;s nice, but I feel like I can #8217;t tell her anything because if you say anything other than you #8217;re doing okay (or better) therapists have to tell parents around here

WRITING.TITLE: What do I do?
WRITING.TEXT: Im very sure I have BPD. I've been doing tons of research over the past few weeks, and I relate to everything. I have every single symptom. Im 13, personality disorders aren't often diagnosed to minors, so I have like a 0% chance of being diagnosed. Im scared to ask for help because of this reason but also I'm very afraid everyone will leave me. I don't know what to do.

WRITING.TITLE: Advice?
WRITING.TEXT: Sometimes I feel like a different person. Like I #8217;m not in control, like I #8217;m not in charge of what I #8217;m doing. A lot of the time when I look at pictures of myself or see my reflection I don #8217;t recognize me. It feels like there #8217;s two (or possibly more) people fighting to control my body. I can barely remember my childhood. All I can remember is some severe bullying I went through. I #8217;m in 8th grade and the first half of 7th grade I don #8217;t really remember. (September to October of 2019). I don #8217;t remember 6th grade at all. I find I lose my memory about some things a lot. It #8217;s just blank sometimes. I don #8217;t really know how to explain it. I don #8217;t really think I have DID, but it may be a possibility? Sorry. This isn #8217;t a lot of information, but again, I don #8217;t really know how to explain it.

WRITING.TITLE: Advice?
WRITING.TEXT: Sometimes I feel like a different person. Like I #8217;m not in control, like I #8217;m not in charge of what I #8217;m doing. A lot of the time when I look at pictures of myself or see my reflection I don #8217;t recognize me. It feels like there #8217;s two (or possibly more) people fighting to control my body. I can barely remember my childhood. All I can remember is some severe bullying I went through. I #8217;m in 8th grade and the first half of 7th grade I don #8217;t really remember. (September to October of 2019). I don #8217;t remember 6th grade at all. I find I lose my memory about some things a lot. It #8217;s just blank sometimes. Sorry this isn #8217;t a lot of information, but I don #8217;t really know how to explain it.

That sounds right. Another thing to add is my style in clothing, what I feel my gender and sexuality is, my hobbies, what I want in life, and my liking towards certain things change very frequently, more than they do in other people. I #8217;m afraid though. What if I #8217;m just faking all of this and I don #8217;t have DID? Isn #8217;t DID caused by major childhood trauma? The only thing I remember is some bullying by another kid. I remember some things he #8217;s done, but I don #8217;t feel as if that #8217;s all of it. These things include stealing my things, blaming stuff he did on me, pushing me into walls, teasing me about my interests, and being rude to my friends (which caused me to have none). He blamed all of this on ADHD and got away with it. This happened all through 2nd to 5th grade. I will agree my parents aren #8217;t the best with emotions and stuff. Every time I bring up something that my dad did that hurt me he gets mad or ignores me. Same with mom. (That #8217;s not all but I don #8217;t really feel like going into that right now). Another reason I #8217;m afraid I might be faking is because I do have in interest in researching about DID. So maybe I #8217;m convincing myself this is happening to me but it isn #8217;t? I don #8217;t know what to think. Edit: also I remember in October of 2019 a #8220;friend #8221; called me a sin. I know she said many other things in the exact moment but that #8217;s all I remember from it. It #8217;s been wiped away or something. I also escape into fictional realities a lot. And I mean a lot. I create people I want in these worlds and basically just have the world the way I want it.
Also, fixed the showing knot! :)

Depends on the person and how I #8217;m feeling. Most of the time I don #8217;t even hug my family members cause it #8217;s just too much. Either it #8217;s from my #10024;child hood trauma #10024; or because of my autism, I #8217;m not sure.

WRITING.TITLE: In the process of decorating my first mask! I need to do one or two more layers of black then I #8217;m going to add some stars :)
Memory Loss (Possible tw!)
WRITING.TEXT: The first vivid memory I have took place a few weeks before my 13th birthday. It was of the first time I self harmed. turning 14 in December this year. All I can remember from my childhood is that I was bullied, but that #8217;s it. Barely any details. I know one boy pushed me into walls, stole my stuff, (and way more I #8217;m not fully aware of but I know happened) but I don #8217;t really have the memories, they #8217;re all cloudy if you know what I mean. The ones that aren #8217;t cloudy don #8217;t even exist. I know I #8217;m October last year (I was 12, so before I cut for the first time) a friend called me a sin in front of a whole class, but I can #8217;t actually access that memory, it #8217;s also cloudy. I just know it happened. Even the memory of me self harming for the first time is starting to get cloudy. I don #8217;t know why I can #8217;t remember anything but I hate it. I hate it so much. Does this happen to you?

WRITING.TITLE: I was watching an old Stampylongnose video and- (also sorry for the poor quality lol)

WRITING.TEXT: You might be asexual! Does it feel uncomfy to think about doing the no-no with anyone? From what I can tell you might not be sure until you try it (if you ever do), but that #8217;s how some asexuals feel when they kiss someone.

I #8217;m asexual and that #8217;s how I feel. Im okay with the idea but I don #8217;t crave it or actually want it, if you know what I mean. I just know it exists and other people like it, so it #8217;s beautiful in that way. (That was hard to word hope it makes sense) Obviously you don #8217;t have to ID as ace if you don #8217;t feel like it, but that might be the answer to your question :)
Me too, it #8217;s so calming

I #8217;ve never been close enough with a boy to develop a crush so I don #8217;t know if it #8217;s possible. The reaction to the thought of having a boyfriend changes. WRITING.TITLE: Welp
WRITING.TEXT: In my opinion the worst part about (possibly, I #8217;m not diagnosed yet cause I #8217;m too afraid to bring it up) having a dissociative disorder is that I can never find my gender or romanticism. The second I get comfy with a label the dissociation hits and I #8217;m questioning all over again. (One of the things that can happen with dissociation is the loss of the sense of identity) The one label that doesn #8217;t seem to change is my asexuality, which honestly I #8217;m starting to believe is because of trauma.

That #8217;s exactly how I feel! Sometimes I think the only reason I #8217;m comfy with being ace and have no problems with it is because trauma. As far as I know, no, I have not been sexually abused, but also the first vivid memory I have is from a few months before my 13th birthday and that #8217;s fading away too, so I might have been. I #8217;m turning 14 in December btw It kind of makes me think that I have to go through a traumatic experience that has to do with being romantic (ex, a toxic relationship) to be proud of who I am. It #8217;s a really toxic mindset to be in and I know it #8217;s wrong but the thought wont go away. Life is fun, isn #8217;t it?

WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;m biqueerplatonic but since I #8217;m lithromantic I just say I #8217;m biromantic (I mean I also am biro) but I never mention being biqueerplatonic. I #8217;ve never had a QPR but I want to be in one, and I already know I #8217;ll call them my girlfriend/enbyfriend/boyfriend (if they #8217;re comfortable with it of course) I think I do this because it #8217;s just easier to explain? And honestly I prefer it. I don #8217;t want to spend an hour telling allos exactly how I feel attraction, it #8217;s not really their business. Am I the only one?

Queerplatonic, like sexual, romantic, and platonic, is a type of relationship and a type of attraction, so basically I can be queerplatonicaly attracted to everyone. (I use bi instead of pan because gender does play a role in my attraction)

Grey on a pride flag is honestly an instant no for me. (For me using the flag, not for me accepting the identity, everyone valid) like sometimes I think I #8217;m genderflux, but the flag.. it makes me feel disconnected to the identity. I love the vibrant flags. They #8217;re so beautiful and I could stare at them for hours. But flags with grey? Yeah no. The grey lithromantic flag seems to have been made with a very specific #8220;type #8221; of lithromantic in mind and I just don #8217;t like it.

WRITING.TITLE: Is this normal?
WRITING.TEXT: So I age regress (to around 8-11) when my autism is triggered or sometimes when Im triggered because of trauma (depending on the thing) It #8217;s all involuntary, it just happens and I don #8217;t have a say in it.
